main event: Sighting of a round, yellowish object traveling very fast observed on September 9, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as the size of a large star., The object followed a zigzag flight path, first moving to the Northeast, then Southeast, and back to the Northeast before disappearing., The sighting lasted for approximately 2 minutes., Observers reported that the object moved faster than any jet aircraft they had seen., The case was evaluated with multiple possible explanations including balloon, aircraft, and astronomical.
witness description: Mr. and Ms. from South Euclid, Ohio
